item.title: Per, AWK and Sed Tricks for Text File Manipulation
item.description: Selecting a paragraph with first line known /^first line content$/,/^$/ works in both AWK and sed for addressing a paragraph, or any content with unique start and end identifiers ...

item.title: ffmpeg
item.description: One-liners Detect encoding errors ffmpeg -err_detect explode -i <infile> -f null - Convert music file to Opus format find . -type f -name '*.flac' | parallel 'test -f {.}.opus || ffmpeg -i {} -vn -c:a libopus -b:a 192k {.}.opus' Keep display aspect ratio when downsampling ffmpeg -i in.mp4 -vf "setsar='if(sar,sar,1)',scale=640x480" out.mp4.

item.title: Best way to add path to PATH environment variable
item.description: Solution if [[ ! "$PATH" == *your_path* ]]; then PATH="${PATH:+${PATH}:}your_path" fi Explanation [[ ! "$PATH" == *your_path* ]] checks if PATH ...

item.title: Here Document
item.description: Parameter expansion Quote the word in here-documents to inhibit any expansion. <<'word' If any part of word is quoted, the delimiter is the result of quote removal on word, and the lines in the here-document are not expanded.

item.title: systemd-analyze
item.description: Subcommands time: analyze startup time set-log-level: set systemd log level .

item.title: ip
item.description: Global options -s for more verbose output (s for statistics). -s -s increases verbosity. Add -h for human readable stats and add -iec to print data size in IEC units (e.g.

item.title: Zsh Word Splitting
item.description: Use $=VAR instead of $VAR to force parameter expansions to split $VAR into separate words before substitution, using the IFS as a delimiter. This is the default in most other shells.

item.title: col
item.description: Convert tabs to spaces ethtool -l eth0 | col -x converts tabs to spaces with proper indentation.

item.title: journalctl
item.description: Useful options -b (show logs from the current boot only) -e (jump to end in pager mode) -x (augment log lines with catalog info, don't use for bug reports) ...
